messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] book request
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, this sounds like the kind of book I want. I have found a listing for it at a local library, so I ll stop by and take a look at it. No problem about
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, this sounds like the kind of book I want. I have found a listing
for it at a local library, so I'll stop by and take a look at it. No
problem about Santa. My son was already "enlightened" by one of his friends
and asked me about it. I told him the truth and he was not at all
disappointed. So much for magic...

:-)
Olivia

> Date: Thu, 14 Dec 2000 14:49:25 -0800 (PST)
> From: Samantha Stopple <sammimag@...>
>Subject: Re: book request
>
>While the Bear Sleeps Retold by Caitlin Matthews
>Is a picture story book. Includes stories about
>Christmas, Hanukka, Winters Soltice, Kwanza, Native
>American etc. The book begins with a young girl
>meeting a bear who takes her on a journey through
>different times and cultures celbrating the winter
>holidays. Very, Very lovely!
>
>Peace,
>Samantha
>
>PS -The book describes history of Santa so if you do
>the Santa thing it may let the mystery go so to speak
>if she doesn't know already....

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] book request
messages.msgSnippet: I am looking for a book about holiday traditions (for a 7 yo) that describes, very simply, various winter seasonal celebrations without leaning towards one
messages.messageBody:
I am looking for a book about holiday traditions (for a 7 yo) that
describes, very simply, various winter seasonal celebrations without
leaning towards one particular religion. Any suggestions?

Olivia

Seems to me there was one from Dorling Kindersley I read a few years ago.
Wish I could think of the title. (I only borrowed it.)

Valerie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] book request
messages.msgSnippet: ... While the Bear Sleeps Retold by Caitlin Matthews Is a picture story book. Includes stories about Christmas, Hanukka, Winters Soltice, Kwanza, Native
messages.messageBody:
--- Olivia <liv2learn@...> wrote:
> I am looking for a book about holiday traditions
> (for a 7 yo) that
> describes, very simply, various winter seasonal
> celebrations without
> leaning towards one particular religion. Any
> suggestions?

While the Bear Sleeps Retold by Caitlin Matthews
Is a picture story book. Includes stories about
Christmas, Hanukka, Winters Soltice, Kwanza, Native
American etc. The book begins with a young girl
meeting a bear who takes her on a journey through
different times and cultures celbrating the winter
holidays. Very, Very lovely!

Peace,
Samantha

PS -The book describes history of Santa so if you do
the Santa thing it may let the mystery go so to speak
if she doesn't know already....
